009package Tools_;
010
011import ij.gui.GenericDialog;
012import ij.plugin.PlugIn;
013import imagingbook.common.util.ClassUtils;
014import imagingbook.core.resource.ImageResource;
015import imagingbook.sampleimages.GeneralSampleImage;
016
017import java.util.Arrays;
018
019/**
020 * ImageJ plugin, allows the user to select and open one of the internal sample images. The image is loaded from the
021 * associated JAR file.
022 *
023 * @author WB
024 * @see GeneralSampleImage
025 */
026public class Open_Sample_Image implements PlugIn {
027
028        @Override
029        public void run(String arg) {
030                GenericDialog gd = new GenericDialog(this.getClass().getSimpleName());
031                GeneralSampleImage[] sortedItems = ClassUtils.getEnumConstantsSorted(GeneralSampleImage.class);
032                // TODO: replace by new GenericDialog method addEnumChoice(enum[] ...)
033                String[] sortedStrings =  Arrays.stream(sortedItems).map(Enum::toString).toArray(String[]::new);
034                gd.addChoice("Select", sortedStrings, sortedStrings[0]);
035
036                // GeneralSampleImage init = GeneralSampleImage.values()[0];
037                // gd.addEnumChoice("Select", init);
038                
039                gd.showDialog();
040                if (gd.wasCanceled())
041                        return;
042
043                String itemString = gd.getNextChoice();
044                ImageResource ir = GeneralSampleImage.valueOf(itemString);
045                
046                // ImageResource ir = gd.getNextEnumChoice(GeneralSampleImage.class);
047                ir.getImagePlus().show();
048        }
049
050}
